Manx: Robbin: “Row fys ayd dy row my ven as mee-hene er nyn ruggey yn laa cheddin?”
English: Robert: “Did you know that my wife and I were born on the same day?”

Manx: “Illiam: “Cha row. Nagh aitt eh! Agh te coyrt ayns cooinaghtyn dou dy row my ven's as mish er nyn boosey yn laa cheddin.”
English: William: “No. How funny! But that reminds me that my wife and myself were married on the same day.”
